Reviews.Title: “A Clean Hotel With Acceptable Services”
Reviews.Author: baltazarb80
Reviews.Content: Advantages: Clean, Good location, Kind Stuff, Wireless Internet, Minimal Breakfast, Budget Misadvantages: Very Small Rooms, Refrigerator didn't work, ... " These items are about 1st floor rooms!! "

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: GoutmanEliz
Reviews.Content: THE DIRTIEST ROOM ONE CAN EVER IMAGINE EXIST! Not at all cheap, 110 euros a night. The toilette seat had dirt and urine drops that have been there for quite some time. the pillows had a brown-ish color underneath the pillowcases... Overall, better off staying in the street, it is definitely clearer!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Katsi123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near train station Termini which was the main reason we booked this hotel. The staff was helpful and nice. Rooms are not big, but that wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Gret experience!”
Reviews.Author: tessie_malta49
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful! The hotel is in a very central area near Stazione Termini... we really enjoyed our experience at this hotel! I really recommend it and I hope to enjoy another holiday in this hotel in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Really bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: NenadMKD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in April 2011 at this hotel with my wife and small child (2 years old). I have extensive experience with hotels in Europe and the USA and this is by far one of my worst choices. Besides the location, that is good, we got an unbelievably small room so our trolley for the child had to be kept in front of the room in the corridor. The room was really ridiculous with a tiny bathroom separated by a sliding wooden door (no privacy at all). I guess that for a couple the hotel might do fine (I doubt it though) but I would really NOT recommend it to people with children. The staff was very formal and unkind at times, so I was stunned when I remembered the reviews I have read concerning the staff being pleasant and helpful. The price was not cheap at all (over 100 euros per night) and the city tax was not included in the price (additional 12 euros for 3 nights for 3 people). The breakfast is miserable (coffee good though) and the breakfast is taking place in an improvised corridor in front of four other rooms (I never figured out whether those rooms belong to this hotel). The reception desk is far apart from the rooms, and the elevator that takes you to the rooms is very tiny and claustrophobic (not really a problem per se). All in all, too expensive, ridiculously small rooms, old and ugly furniture, nothing Italian and stylish. Would NOT recommend it (maybe for half the price) and especially not to people with children.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at Termini”
Reviews.Author: Rosingfamily
Reviews.Content: This is a little hotel - but a lovely one. From the hotel there are a short walk to all the things you want to see. The rooms are small and you only miss a refrigerator. Tere are a little terrace at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for Family”
Reviews.Author: lalluDubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel. close to market, shopping, metro, easy to get transport. Staff are very helful and frindly. my next trip i will stay same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok!”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Lek
Reviews.Content: If you seek for a quiet, next to the central train station and clean hotel I would recommend it. The owner is a polite man though he doesn't speak english ....it's funny...at the end you can communicate perfectly. When you entrance the "hotel" you are not sure if you are at the right place. Actually, it is not a hotel... it's a pansion I think or something like that. The rooms are clean without any luxury. The important is that you hold your room keys all day long. The bathroom is very small but that was not a problem. The region (termini station) is of bad reputation but it's the best start to explore rome. Overall, the hotel is clean and value for money. But that's all. If you travel with friends I think it is a "ok" place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: bp2008London_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood for just one night and that was enough. For a cheap night near the train station it was ok but I wouldn't have wanted to stay any longer. The room was average in size for an Italian hotel room but the shower didn't work. Didn't bother complaining as we were leaving anyway. Wouldn't stay here again - there are so many cheap places near the station I'm sure you could find a better one for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beats staying at a hostel”
Reviews.Author: nevets_83
Reviews.Content: I was backpacking through Europe with friends and we hated our hostel and found this hotel for the same price it would cost 4 of us to stay at a dirty, shared bathroom hostel. The room was cleaned daily, air conditioned and located near the train station. I didnt need any services so it was fine that the only time I saw a hotel employee was at check in and check out. I liked the fact the the hotel felt like an apartment as my room was blended into an apartment complex. Overall a very enjoyable stay considering we left the worlds most dirties hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel "HELL"-ywood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps one of the worst hotels I have stayed in during my travels in Europe over the last 8 years. We were directed to this hotel after another hotel cancelled our reservation. We were assured that this hotel was of similar quality and in an area close to the train station. When we arrived the man behind the desk was arguing with a previous guest about their bill and refusing to take a credit card for payment. When we spoke with the clerk/owner, he demanded payment in full up front. This should have been our clue to leave. We ended up paying because we couldn't find any other rooms even close to our price range. We paid 120 euros/night. After spending one night in the room, we were ready to leave. The shower had no water pressure and would not drain. The toilet wouldn't flush properly (it tok 4-6 flushes just to get some toilet paper to go down, much less anything else). The cups at the sink had a white crust on them and the halls smelled like a dirty nursing home. We complained to the front desk and were assured that it would be looked into. upon our return that night, we found no change in the plumbing for the bathroom. Also, don't let the pictures fool you. They are taken with a "fish-eye" lens. The rooms are barely big enough for the bed. we had about two feet of space around the bed. There is no direct dial telephone. you have to call the reception and give them the number to call. If it is after midnight, then you have a different extension to dial and hope that it wakes someone up so they can place the call for you. In closing, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone no matter how desperate you might be.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for low-maintenance types”
Reviews.Author: Stinger296
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The staff spoke english well and were very friendly. The location is excellent, right near the train station with Metro access. Also, across the street is an internet and phone cafe. I stayed alone in a private room for 2 nights at $62 USD/night. The first night I was upgraded to a room meant for 4. There was another bedroom and a shared kitchen, living room and bath and a terrace (it was the top floor). It was very nice. The sheets, bathroom, etc were clean. The second night I stayed in the room I booked. It was spartan in style, just a bed, sink and closet. The bathroom was off the hallway shared by 2 other rooms. For each room I had 4 keys, one for the main door off the street, another for the hallway door, one for the room and one for the bathroom. There was never an issue sharing the bathrooms. It seemed everyone else staying there did the same thing I did, and spent very little waking time in the hotel. For the budget-conscious who only need a clean, safe, room, this is a great place.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 79/a, 00185 Rome, Italy
